comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Two KA-3B Skywarrior VAH-10 ‘Vikings’ Modex 611 Bu No 138946 (looked like 138948 but this crashed in 1960) VAH-10 ‘Vikings’ Modex 612 Bu No 138971 Tail code NP of Carrier Air Wing Twenty One (CVW-21) Info about VAH-10 on these 'GO!NAVY' webpages: www.gonavy.jp/navy/sqn/VAQ129.html www.gonavy.jp/CVW-NPf.html VAH-10 DET.19 Vikings using Modex codes 610, 611 & 612 are recorded as being with CVW-21 code NP between Aug.2, 1969 & April 15, 1970 onboard CVA-19 USS HANCOCK for a west Pacific, South China Sea and Tonkin Gulf deployment in support of the Vietnam War. (Thanks to Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan and naval aviation historian) Dedicated webpage to A-3 Skywarrior production: www.a3skywarrior.com/html_files/a-3production.html (courtesy of 'A-3 Skywarrior Association') …………………………………………………………………………………………… Notes on KA-3B 138946; Built as A3D-2 Number 99 on Skywarrior production line Accepted by US Navy July 1957 Became A-3B from 1962 Converted to KA-3B by NARF Alameda June 1967 Retired to desert storage at the then MASDC as AN2A0045 June 24, 1970 Possibly salvaged at MASDC Jan 1972. Another 'flickr' pic with A3D-2 138946 included: www.flickr.com/photos/my_public_domain_photos/4496111025/ Many thanks to contributor 'aeroman3' 1963 picture of A-3B Skywarrior 138946: geta-o.maxs.jp/USMIL/A/A-3/A-3B/A-3B.htm geta-o.maxs.jp/USMIL/A/A-3/A-3B/138946(nk206)a-3b-0166.jpg VAH-10. Modex code 206. Large sword emblem of VAH-10 ‘Vikings’. Tail code NK of CVG-14 when assigned to CVA-64 USS Constellation between Feb.21 & Sept 10 1963 (WestPac cruise). Seen over NAF Atsugi, Japan. Picture with both KA-3B 138946 & 138971included: www.a3skywarriorforwhidbey.org/images/vah-10_138971_13894... www.a3skywarriorforwhidbey.org/photos.htm Tail code NP of CVW-21. Modex codes 611 & 612. Sword emblem of VAH-10 ‘Vikings’. Date claimed on pic may be incorrect as VAH-10 only served with CVW-21 1969 to 1970 aboard CVA-19 USS Hancock. Caption reads 1975 but more likely 1970 as from info for VAH-10 with KA-3B here: www.gonavy.jp/CVW-NPf.html ………………………………………………………………………………… Notes on KA-3B 138971 Built as A3D-2 Number 122 on Skywarrior production line. Accepted by US Navy Sept 1957. Became A-3B from 1962 Converted to KA-3B by NARF Alameda June 1967. To the then MASDC as AN2A0055 Mar 4, 1971 in the Arizona desert. [Now AMARG] Scrapped at MASDC Jan 1972 ? Picture including KA-3B 138971 of VAH-4 as Modex 11: www.vaq34.com/a3list/138902-138976.htm A picture of KA-3B 138971 from another 'flickr' contributor: www.flickr.com/photos/tailspin_tommy/431718214/ VAH-4, 'Fourrunners' DET 63. Modex 4. Tail code ZB with diagonal fuselage stripes. (many thanks to 'TailspinT') Another picture of KA-3B 138971 from a 'flickr' contributor: www.flickr.com/photos/77968948@N00/4289640064/ VAH-4, 'Fourrunners' DET 63. Modex 4. Tail code ZB with diagonal fuselage stripes. From info on this website and web page: www.gonavy.jp/index.html www.gonavy.jp/CVW11-NH1967.html Between Nov.18th 1967 & June 28th 1968 CVA-63 USS KITTY HAWK with Carrier Air Wing Eleven (CVW-11) was on Vietnam War deployment. VAH-4 DET.63 (tail code ZB) with KA-3B was the refueling squadron. Detachment aircraft numbered 1 to 6. Number 4 was 138971 Here is a picture with KA-3B 138971 included, aboard USS KITTY HAWK dated 1968: zh.wikipedia.org/zh/File:RA-5C_RVAH-11_CVA-63_1968.jpg Here is a picture with KA-3B 138971 included as Modex 11 with five other VAH-4 KA-3B: www.vaq34.com/a3list/138971.jpg www.vaq34.com/a3list/138902-138976.htm
